{{cpp/locale/messages/title|get|do_get}}
{{cpp/locale/messages/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|locale}}
{{dcl|num=1|1=
public:
string_type get( catalog cat, int set, int msgid, const string_type&amp; dfault ) const;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|1=
protected:
virtual string_type do_get( catalog cat, int set, int msgid, const string_type&amp; dfault ) const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

@1@ Public member function, calls the protected virtual member function {{tt|do_get}} of the most derived class.

@2@ Obtains a message from the open message catalog {{c|cat}} using the values {{c|set}}, {{c|msgid}} and {{c|dfault}} in implementation-defined manner. If the expected message is not found in the catalog, returns a copy of {{c|dfault}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|cat|identifier of message catalog obtained from {{lc|open()}} and not yet passed to {{lc|close()}}}}
{{par|set|implementation-defined argument, message set in POSIX}}
{{par|msgid|implementation-defined argument, message id in POSIX}}
{{par|dfault|the string to look up in the catalog (if the catalog uses string look-up) and also the string to return in case of a failure}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The message from the catalog or a copy of {{c|dfault}} if none was found.

===Notes===
On POSIX systems, this function call usually translates to a call to {{tt|[https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799/functions/catgets.html catgets()]}}, and the parameters {{c|set}}, {{c|msgid}}, and {{c|dfault}} are passed to {{tt|catgets()}} as-is. In GNU libstdc++, this function ignores {{c|set}} and {{c|msgid}} and simply calls GNU {{c|gettext(dfault)}} in the required locale.
